questions.question_text: What are two required Active Directory permissions for the Instant Clone Domain Admin account? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B and C

... Add the Create Computer Objects, Delete Computer Objects, and Write All Properties permissions to the account on the container for the instant-clone computer accounts

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.0/com.vmware.horizon-view.installation.doc/GUID-E91881F4-F8C0-48A5-A1A4-61577E287E29.html

The correct answers are B and C. under procedures, item 2. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.0/com.vmware.horizon-view.installation.doc/GUID-E91881F4-F8C0-48A5-A1A4-61577E287E29.html

Agree with vm_guy_01 - bad questions, all ABC is required.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.0/com.vmware.horizon-view.installation.doc/GUID-E91881F4-F8C0-48A5-A1A4-
61577E287E29.html
Bad question. Read All Properties, Write all Properties and Create Computer Objects are all required for an IC account in AD.

comments.content:
Its not a bad question. Just the wrong answer. Should be BC.
If you have "write" privileges, it comes with the "read"

discussion.content: Correct Answer: B C
I agree write all properties and create computer objects

by https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.0/com.vmware.horizon-view.installation.doc/GUID-E91881F4-F8C0-48A5-A1A4-61577E287E29.html
we need "create Computer Objects, Delete Computer Objects, and Write All Properties".
right answer is C) create Computer Objects B) Write All Properties

As a best practice, you defragment the master first, then disable the scheduled defragmentation.

"When you prepare a parent virtual machine for instant clones or View Composer linked clones, it is
recommended that you disable scheduled defragmentation. Windows schedule weekly disk
defragmentations by default. Defragmentation significantly increase the size of a clone's virtual disk and
does not make disk access more efficient for instant clones or View Composer linked clones"
As a best practice, defragment the parent or master image virtual machine before you take a snapshot and create the pool.

C ?
https://docs.vmware.com/jp/VMware-Horizon-7/7.3/horizon-virtual-desktops/GUID-4CC1DFBC-A01A-4CC7-9A1F-09AD1A2C233A.html

choices.C: Run a disk defragmentation and then disable automatic defragmentation tasks prior to publishing the desktop
choices.D: Do not run a disk defragmentation but disable automatic defragmentation tasks prior to publishing the desktop
choices.B: Do not run a disk defragmentation but schedule automatic defragmentation tasks prior to publishing the desktop
choices.A: Run a disk defragmentation and then schedule automatic defragmentation tasks prior to publishing the desktop

questions.question_text: When preparing a master image for a virtual desktop infrastructure environment, how should disk defragmentation be configured?
How does User Environment Manager use the Profile Archive file share?

discussion.content:
Correct answer C
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Dynamic-Environment-Manager/9.8/com.vmware.user.environment.manager-install-config/GUID-92BA0CD9-72B8-4F91-A612-61B69EE60E45.html#:~:text=The%20share%20contains%20User%20Environment,launches%20a%20DirectFlex%2Denabled%20application.
C is the correct answer. The Flex configuration files are stored in the DEM Config share. The Profile Archive share contains the user personalizes settings (in ZIP format)
Yes, I agree. It should be A.

It should not be A: ?
Profile archives are ZIP files in whichFlexEngine stores the personalized settings of users, based on the content of Flex configuration files. For each Flex configuration file you create, a profile archive will be created for each user.

choices.C: It stores the user personalization settings
choices.B: It stores the FlexEngine executable files for distribution
choices.D: It stores backups of the user personalization settings

discussion.content:
The logon duration for some sessions might be unavailable in vRealize Operations for Horizon. This problem occurs when the time on different components is not synchronized.

Procedure
Synchronize all broker agents, desktop agents, and event databases to an NTP server.
Restart the broker agent service.

A and D is correct

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vRealize-Operations-for-Horizon/6.5/com.vmware.vrealize.horizon.admin/GUID-3312F598-8ADE-4106-BFC5-5E023FBC83B0.html
Thanks for the link!
actual link https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vRealize-Operations-for-Horizon/6.5/com.vmware.vrealize.horizon.admin/GUID-3312F598-8ADE-4106-BFC5-5E023FBC83B0.html

choices.D: Synchronize time on Horizon Broker Agent, Desktop Agent and Events DB
choices.C: Enable the logon duration option in the Horizon Broker Agent configuration

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
